results.title: The Stage to three
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparisons”.
An introduction to three entertainers of outstanding talent: Katina Paxinou, an actress from Greece, Chatuporn Ratanavarah, demon dancer of Thailand, and Bruno Gerussi, a Canadian actor.

group_siblings.title: Four families
group_siblings.creator_credit: John Buss, William Novic, Fali Bilimoria, Richard Gilbert, Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Four families
results.creator_credit: John Buss, William Novic, Fali Bilimoria, Richard Gilbert, Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparisons”.
An on-the-spot comparison of family life in India, France, Japan and Canada, in which the internationally known author/anthropologist, Dr Margaret Mead, discusses with the film’s writer/director how the upbringing of children contributes to a distinctive national character. Centre of attention in each case is a year-old baby in the family of a farmer of average means. Dr Mead summarises the more typical national characteristics at the conclusion of the film.

results.title: One-sided triangle
results.creator_credit: David Evans, Sheppard Moscow Audio-Visual and Millbank Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Communicating”.
Concerned with effective communication within the working group or team. It spotlights the nature of behaviour and its causes when people meet in groups and points to the things that need to be done to maximise group effectiveness.

results.title: A Question of may
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Communicating”.
A corporate training film on the nature and importance of effective communication skills within the work place. A mock training session is intercut with dramatic situations depicting the problems of miscommunication.

results.title: Blowing hot and cold
results.creator_credit: David Evans, Sheppard Moscow Audio-Visual and Millbank Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Communicating”.
Uses an example of conflict between sales and production staff over a new product to illustrate the importance of maintaining efficient communication between groups. Explores some methods of reducing conflict.

results.title: Earl of Home
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and British Information Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Commonwealth Teleview”.
In an interview with Robert McKenzie, the Earl of Home, Britain’s Secretary of State for Commonwealth Relations, discusses present and future trends of the British Commonwealth and talks about some of the links and common aims that bind this family of nations together.
